payload.name: adversarial-red-team
payload.core: Systematically attack a system, argument, or plan from an adversary's perspective to discover exploitable weaknesses before deployment. Specify attack paths (sequence of actions), not just concerns.
out: attack_trees: hierarchical decomposition of adversary goal achievement
failure_catalog: enumerated failures with likelihood and impact
assumption_hit_list: assumptions that would cause failure if false
residual_risk_register: unmitigated vulnerabilities with accept/defer rationale
proc: scope target and define trust boundary
generate attack vectors using STRIDE/MITRE ATT&CK taxonomies
report findings with severity and remediation timeline
check: each finding has concrete attack path
challenged own assumptions beyond obvious surface
residual risk register has explicit accept/defer decisions

diff.robust-worst-case: robust defends with margins; red-team attacks to find insufficient margins
diff.assurance-case: assurance argues safety; red-team challenges arguments as adversarial complement
diff.counterexample-guided: CEGAR refines abstractions formally; red-team breaks real systems empirically
diff.game-theoretic: game theory models equilibrium; red-team exploits any weakness

fail.name: cynicism_theater
fail.desc: clever-sounding attacks without prioritizing real risk
signs: long lists of unvalidated theoretical vulnerabilities
mitigations: require exploitation proof with reproducible steps
explicit adversary model before generating attacks

use: security audits: pentesting, threat modeling, vulnerability assessment
argument review: logical gaps, weak evidence

ex.target: employee onboarding system with auto-provisioned cloud access
ex.adversary: disgruntled employee with valid credentials, moderate skill
path: use onboarding API to provision elevated service account access
use service account post-departure to exfiltrate data
ex.finding: API lacks auth check for elevated access; service accounts not tied to employee lifecycle
ex.mitigation: add manager-approval workflow; link service account expiry to termination
